str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pais; to train up a child, i.e. Educate, or, discipline.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To flog, scourge, the victim being strapped to a pole or frame; met: I chastise. From mastix; to flog.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To receive, accept, acknowledge. From para and dechomai; to accept near, i.e. Admit or delight in.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
